docs.title: The Global Groundwater Information System (GGIS)
docs.text:
GGIS is a groundwater information system developed for and funded by UN-IGRAC. The GGIS is an interactive portal for sharing data and information on groundwater resources around the world. It gives access to map layers, documents, and well and monitoring data. It also contains several thematic map viewers.

You can visit the live site here: https://ggis.un-igrac.org

docs.title: Administration
docs.text:
This section explains specific IGRAC tasks:

  • Geonode Popup: How to add popups to Geonode resources such as datasets, maps, documents, or geostories.
  • Contributors: Explanation of the contributors feature and how to configure it.

docs.title: Contributors
docs.text: The Contributors feature allows you to view the contributors of layers. It displays a list of organizations along with their metadata.

docs.title: How to Set Up
docs.text:
Contributors are based on the IGRAC layers in Django.

  • Production: https://ggis.un-igrac.org/en-us/admin/igrac/groundwaterlayer/
  • Staging: https://igrac.sta.do.kartoza.com/en-us/admin/igrac/groundwaterlayer/

These layers represent well and monitoring data, and their variants. Contributors are linked to these layers through the organizations and organization groups associated with them.

To manage contributor content, update the related organizations:

  • Production: https://ggis.un-igrac.org/en-us/admin/gwml2/organisation/
  • Staging: https://igrac.sta.do.kartoza.com/en-us/admin/gwml2/organisation/

docs.title: Setting the Time Range
docs.text:
For each organization:

  • If it's used by a harvester, it will display: "Updated automatically (via API)"
  • If not, the time range will be calculated from the first and last measurements

To calculate it manually:

  1. Select one or more organizations
  2. Choose the Assign Data action from the dropdown

docs.title: Geonode Popup
docs.text:
Geonode Popup is a feature that displays content from a Wagtail Rich Text ** field on a Geonode page. It can appear on maps, datasets, geostories, and documents**.

Here’s an example:

docs.title: How to Set It Up
docs.text: To use this feature, you need to create a Geonode Page in the Wagtail admin.

docs.title: 2. Open the Pages List
docs.text: Make sure you're on the root page. Click Pages in the sidebar. A slide-out menu will appear — click Pages at the top.

docs.title: 4. Select “Geonode Page”
docs.text:
Choose the Geonode Page type — this is required for the popup to work.

⚠️ Make sure not to select the wrong type!

docs.title: 5. Fill Out the Form
docs.text:
Complete the fields in the form:

  1. Title – Any title you like.
  2. Intro – Optional intro text (not used in the popup).
  3. Body – This is the Rich Text field that will appear in the popup.
  4. Maps – Select the maps where this popup should appear.
  5. Datasets – Select the datasets that will use this popup.
  6. Documents – Select the documents linked to this popup.
  7. Geostories – Select the geostories where the popup will be shown.

docs.title: 6. Publish the Page
docs.text: Click the “arrow up” icon, then click “Publish”.

docs.title: ✅ The Popup Is Ready!
docs.text:
You can now view the popup on the selected map, dataset, geostory, or document.

Here’s your updated section for Multiple Content and Ordering, with improved grammar, structure, and clarity:

docs.title: Multiple Content
docs.text:
You can assign multiple pages to a single map (or dataset, document, or geostory). All associated pages will appear in order in the popup, separated by newlines.

To do this, simply follow the same setup steps as before. Even if a resource (map, dataset, etc.) is already assigned to another page, you can still assign it to additional pages.

docs.title: Ordering Multiple Contents
docs.text:
If a resource (map, dataset, document, or geostory) has multiple popups, you can customize their display order.

Here’s how:

docs.title: 2. Open the Pages List
docs.text: Make sure you're in the root page. Click Pages in the sidebar. A slide-out menu will appear — click Pages at the top.

docs.title: 3. Reorder Pages
docs.text:
To change the order:

  1. Click the three dots at the top-right of the page list.
  2. Select “Sort menu order”.

You’ll see drag handles (dots) appear next to each page.

Use drag-and-drop to reorder the pages.

💡 The order saves automatically after you move an item.

docs.title: 4. Confirm the Order
docs.text: Visit the map (or dataset, document, or geostory) and confirm the popups appear in the correct order.

docs.title: Harvester
docs.text:
This section explains how the Harvester system works. The Harvester is responsible for pulling well data from third-party sources.

  • SGU (Sweden): https://www.sgu.se/

docs.title: SGU
docs.text: SGU is a harvester used to collect groundwater data from SGU Sweden. The data is categorized into three types: Water Level, Water Quality, and Springs.

docs.title: Water Level
docs.text: Water level data can be referenced from SGU’s main page: 👉 https://www.sgu.se/grundvatten/grundvattennivaer/matstationer

docs.title: Getting Stations
docs.text: The list of wells to be fetched is available via this API: 👉 https://apps.sgu.se/grundvattennivaer-rest/stationer

docs.title: Getting Measurements for Each Well
docs.text:
Use the following API endpoint to fetch water level data for a specific station:

https://resource.sgu.se/oppnadata/grundvatten/api/grundvattennivaer/nivaer/station/{{station_id}}?format=json

Important Fields:

  • datum_for_matning → Date of measurement
  • grundvattenniva_m_o.h. → Groundwater level (in meters above sea level)

docs.title: Water Quality
docs.text: Water quality data can be referenced from SGU’s main page: 👉 https://www.sgu.se/grundvatten/miljoovervakning-av-grundvatten/kartvisare-och-diagram-for-miljoovervakning-av-grundvattenkemi/

docs.title: Getting Stations
docs.text:
To fetch stations for water quality monitoring, use:

https://resource.sgu.se/oppnadata/grundvatten/api/miljoovervakning/stationer/{{lanskod}}?format=json

The system loops through all available lanskod values.

docs.title: Getting Measurements for Each Well
docs.text:
Use the following API to get measurement data for a station:

https://resource.sgu.se/oppnadata/grundvatten/api/miljoovervakning/station/{{station_id}}?format=json

Important Fields:

  • provtagningsdatum → Date of measurement
  • paramnamn_kort → Parameter name
  • matvardetal → Value
  • enhet → Unit

docs.title: List of Measurements
docs.text:
To fetch the correct parameter, create a new parameter in your system using the exact value found in paramnamn_kort.

docs.title: Springs
docs.text: Springs data can be referenced from SGU’s main page: 👉 https://apps.sgu.se/kartvisare/kartvisare-kallor.html

docs.title: Getting Stations
docs.text:
The list of wells to be fetched is available via this API: 👉 https://api.sgu.se/oppnadata/kallor/ogc/features/v1/collections/kallor/items?f=application%2Fvnd.ogc.fg%2Bjson

Important Fields:

  • obsdat → Date of measurement
  • For parameter, we need to setup on the django admin on the Harvester parameter maps
